com.google.appinventor.client.explorer.commands
Class ChainableCommand

java.lang.Object
  com.google.appinventor.client.explorer.commands.ChainableCommand
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddFormCommand, BuildCommand, CopyYoungAndroidProjectCommand, DeleteFileCommand, DownloadFileCommand, DownloadProjectOutputCommand, DownloadToPhoneCommand, EnsurePhoneConnectedCommand, SaveAllEditorsCommand, SaveBlocksCommand, ShowBarcodeCommand, WaitForBuildResultCommand
public abstract class ChainableCommand
extends Object

Abstract base class for chainable commands that perform some action on a ProjectNode. A command may be synchronous or asynchronous.

Each subclass must implement willCallExecuteNextCommand().

Each subclass whose willCallExecuteNextCommand returns true, must call executeNextCommand(com.google.appinventor.shared.rpc.project.ProjectNode) after its own command has completed successfully and must call executionFailedOrCanceled() if its own command execution fails or has been canceled.

Author:
lizlooney@google.com (Liz Looney)

Method Detail

getElapsedMillis

protected final int getElapsedMillis()
Returns the elapsed milliseconds that this link took to execute

willCallExecuteNextCommand

protected abstract boolean willCallExecuteNextCommand()
Method that needs to be overridden by subclasses to indicate whether or not they will call executeNextCommand when done and executionFailedOrCanceled upon failure/cancelation.

This method should only return false if the subclass cannot determine when it has finished.

startExecuteChain

public final void startExecuteChain(String actionName,
                                    ProjectNode node)
Kick off the chain of commands.

Parameters:
actionName - the name of action this chain of commands represents
node - the project node to which the chain of commands is applied

startExecuteChain

public final void startExecuteChain(String actionName,
                                    ProjectNode node,
                                    Command finallyCommand)
Kick off the chain of commands.

Parameters:
actionName - the name of action this chain of commands represents
node - the project node to which the chain of commands is applied
finallyCommand - a command to execute after the chain is finished, regardless of whether it succeeds

execute

protected abstract void execute(ProjectNode node)
Method that needs to be overridden by subclasses to implement the actual behavior of the command. Do not call this directly (call startExecuteChain instead)!

Parameters:
node - the project node to which the command is applied

protected final void executeNextCommand(ProjectNode node)
Executes the next command in the chain.

Parameters:
